Remarks: the condition is general, habitual, actual or logical
Remarks.1: the consequence is certain or have constant result
Sentence: この橋を渡ると学校が見える。
Translation: If you cross this bridge, you can see the school.
Sentence.1: このボタンを押すとドアが開きます。
Translation.1: If you press this button, the door will open

Remarks: the condition is generic hypothetical
Remarks.1: the consequence is always or invariably happens
Sentence: 朝早く出発すればその列車に間に合うでしょう。
Translation: If you leave early in the morning, you can catch that train.
Sentence.1: もっと勉強すれば試験に合格できますよ。
Translation.1: If you study more, you can pass the exam.

Remarks: the condition is hypothetical, uncertain, specific, one-time, or temporal
Remarks.1: the consequence is dependent on the condition
Sentence: それは落としたら割れるだろう。
Translation: That would break if dropped.
Sentence.1: 明日雨が降ったら家にいよう。
Translation.1: If it rains tomorrow, let’s stay home.

Remarks: the condition is hypothetical, contextual or preferential
Remarks.1: the consequence is independent of the condition
Sentence: 訪れるなら早朝がオススメです。
Translation: An early morning is recommended if you visit here.
Sentence.1: 日本語が上手になりたいなら毎日練習しなさい。
Translation.1: If you want to become good at Japanese, practice every day.

Meaning: when・at the time・a point in time
Remarks: situation that happens at the same time or in sequence
Sentence: 日本に行くときパスポートを持っていきます
Translation: When I go to Japan, I take my passport.
Sentence.1: 日本に行ったときたくさん写真を撮りました。
Translation.1: When I went to Japan, I took a lot of photos.

Meaning: at the time of・on the occasion of
Remarks: emphasizes a specific point of time or situation
Remarks.1: often used with verbs that express a change or an occurrence
Sentence: 電話をかけるときに電池が切れました。
Translation: The battery died when I was making a phone call.
Sentence.1: 試験のときに答えを忘れました。
Translation.1: I forgot the answer during the exam.

Remarks: emphasizes a general or habitual action or situation
Remarks.1: often used with verbs that express an action or a state
Sentence: 食べるときは手を洗います。
Translation: I wash my hands when I eat.
Sentence.1: 雨が降るときは傘を持ちます。
Translation.1: I take an umbrella when it rains.

Remarks: indicates the entire period of time or situation when something is happening
Sentence: レポートが生成される間お待ちください。
Translation: Please wait while the report is generated.
Sentence.1: このオプションを使用できるのは承認待ちの間だけです。
Translation.1: This option is only available while approval is pending.

Remarks: indicates a specific point of time or situation when something happens
Remarks.1: used with verbs that express a change or an occurrence
Sentence: 電話をしている間にドアベルが鳴りました。
Translation: The doorbell rang while I was on the phone.
Sentence.1: 昼寝をしている間に地震がありました。
Translation.1: There was an earthquake while I was taking a nap.

Remarks: indicates the time or event that follows another time or event
Remarks.1: usually followed by a noun or a verb in the past tense
Remarks.2: used when action or condition is continuing
Sentence: 電話を切ったあと彼からメールが来た。
Translation: After I hung up the phone, he sent me an email.
Sentence.1: 昼ご飯のあと散歩に行きました。
Translation.1: After lunch, I went for a walk.

Remarks: indicate the specific point in time that follows another point in time
Remarks.1: usually followed by a noun or a verb in the past tense
Remarks.2: emphasizes the timing of the second action
Sentence: 飛行機が出発したあとに荷物を忘れたことに気づいた。
Translation: I realized that I forgot my luggage after the plane departed.
Sentence.1: 卒業式のあとに友達と写真を撮りました。
Translation.1: I took a picture with my friends after the graduation ceremony.

Remarks: indicate the action that is done after another action is completed.
Remarks.1: usually followed by a noun or a verb in the past tense
Remarks.2: used when succeeding event happens later
Sentence: 宿題をしたあとでテレビを見ました。
Translation: After I did my homework, I watched TV.
Sentence.1: 話し合いのあとで決めましょう。
Translation.1: Let’s decide after the discussion.

Meaning: due to and on and on

Remarks: typical characteristics or essence of a thing
Sentence: 北海道らしい景色を目にすることができるでしょう。
Translation: You will be able to see the scenery that is typical of Hokkaido.
Sentence.1: 誰かに東京<b>らしい<b>風景って何ですか。
Translation.1: What is a typical Tokyo scenery to someone?

Remarks: judgment based on what was seen or heard at that moment
Sentence: 車で移動すると約６時間かかるらしい。
Translation: It seems it takes about 6 hours to drive by car.
Sentence.1: この花は珍しいらしい。
Translation.1: This flower is said to be rare.

Remarks: indicates how something is done or how something appears
Remarks.1: used to modify another verb or adjective
Sentence: この部屋はきれいらしく片付けられています。
Translation: This room is tidied up neatly.
Sentence.1: 彼女は怒っているらしく話しかけないでください。
Translation.1: She seems to be angry, so please don’t talk to her.

Remarks: requesting or ordering something
Sentence: クリームと砂糖を入れたコーヒーをください。
Translation: Please give me coffee with cream and sugar.
Sentence.1: ご連絡をください。
Translation.1: Please contact me.

Remarks: describe some characteristics of people or things
Remarks.1: show some qualities or properties of people or things
Sentence: この花は香りをしています。
Translation: This flower has a fragrance.
Sentence.1: この材料は高い品質をしています。
Translation.1: This material has a high quality.

Remarks: doing things together or to to each other
Remarks.1: action is bidirectional or reciprocal between two parties
Remarks.2: two actions happen at the same time or in coordination
Sentence: 撮った写真をお互いに見せ合った。
Translation: We showed each other the pictures we had taken.
Sentence.1: 彼らは一緒に勉強合った。
Translation.1: They studied together.

Meaning: do in response・do in competition・do in comparison
Remarks: action is done in response to something else
Remarks.1: action is done in competition or comparison with someone else
Sentence: 彼女は彼の挨拶に笑い合った。
Translation: She smiled in response to his greeting.
Sentence.1: 彼女は彼と比較合った。
Translation.1: She compared herself with him.

Meaning: finally・after much・after all・in the end
Remarks: tried many things but end up with adverse result
Sentence: 駅で１時間も待ったあげく彼は結局来なかった。
Translation: After waiting for an hour at the station, he never showed up.
Sentence.1: 彼らは話し合いのあげく別れることにした。
Translation.1: They decided to break up after talking it over.

Remarks: something that is done excessively or has an extreme result
Sentence: 遅刻しないように急いだあまり忘れ物をしてしまった。
Translation: In my haste to not be late, I forgot something.
Sentence.1: 彼は勉強するあまり食事も忘れた。
Translation.1: He studied so much that he forgot to eat.

Remarks: degree is so great that an unusual result has occurred
Sentence: 彼女のあまりの美しさについ見惚れてしまった。
Translation: I couldn't help but admire her so much beauty.
Sentence.1: あまりの面白さにしばらくの間笑いが止まらなかったほどだ。
Translation.1: It was so funny that I couldn't stop laughing for a while.

Remarks: degree is so great that an unusual result has occurred
Sentence: あまりの忙しさで体調を崩してしまった。
Translation: I got sick from being so busy.
Sentence.1: あまりの恐怖で、声が一言も出なかった。
Translation.1: I was so terrified that I could not utter a single word.

Remarks: indicates that the degree or frequency is not high
Sentence: この本はあまり面白くない。
Translation: This book is not so interesting.
Sentence.1: あまり難しい問題ではないと思います。
Translation.1: It was so funny that I couldn't stop laughing for a while.

Remarks: regardless of degree
Remarks.1: unaffected by degree or quantity
Sentence: いくら頑張っても合格できなければ意味がない。
Translation: No matter how hard you work, it is meaningless if you cannot pass the exam.

Remarks: regardless of degree
Remarks.1: unaffected by degree or quantity
Sentence: どんなに忙しくても宿題はしなければならない。
Translation: No matter how busy you are, you must do your homework.

Meaning: so long as・more than the・above being
Remarks: judgment, decisions or recommendation is natural
Remarks.1: volition, appeal or prohibitions may also follow
Sentence: この学校に入学した以上は校則は守らなければならない。
Translation: As long as you are enrolled in this school, you must abide by the school rules.

Remarks: change in condition will continue
Remarks.1: to proceed in one direction
Sentence: 水不足で野菜の値段は上がる一方だ。
Translation: Water shortages are driving up vegetable prices.

Remarks: certain state continues after action is completed
Remarks.1: cannot be used for the near past and for the future
Remarks.2: not used when later action occurs only once.
Sentence: 妊娠以来私はお酒を飲んでいない。
Translation: I have not had a drink since my pregnancy.

Remarks: express a preparatory action
Remarks.1: for a relatively important action
Remarks.2: verbs of volition and non-passive precede and follow ue de
Sentence: しっかりと面接した上で誰を採用するか決めます。
Translation: After a thorough interview, we will decide who to hire.

Remarks: occurrences with same directionality
Remarks.1: as in a previous situation
Sentence: この料理は美味しい上にとってもヘルシーだ。
Translation: This dish is delicious and very healthy.

Remarks: during the time of situation with unknown end
Remarks.1: before the situation changes
Sentence: 雨が降り出さないうちに帰りましょう。
Translation: Let's go home before it starts to rain.

Remarks: auxiliary verb that express possibility
Sentence: より複雑な状況も起こり得る。
Translation: More complex situations can also occur.

Remarks: auxiliary verb that express possibility of none
Sentence: 状況が変わり得ないというのは真実ではありません。
Translation: It is not true that the situation cannot change.

Remarks: describe the action of other person in honorific form
Sentence: どのようなお部屋をお探しでしょうか。
Translation: What kind of room are you looking for?

Remarks: express appreciation for something
Remarks.1: show good results
Sentence: 海外保険に入っていたおかげで入院費を払わずに済んだ。
Translation: Thanks to my overseas insurance, I did not have to pay for hospitalization.

Remarks: express interval quantity is denoted
Remarks.1: by the noun preceded by the pattern
Sentence: 洗濯は１週間おきにしています
Translation: I do laundry every other week.

Meaning: there is a fear of・there is a risk of
Remarks: there is concern about the possibility of being
Remarks.1: something bad is likely to happen
Remarks.2: expression often used in news and reports
Sentence: 今夜から明日にかけて全国で大雨のおそれがあります。
Translation: There is a threat of heavy rainfall across the country tonight and tomorrow.

Remarks: express an occasion
Sentence: 実家へ帰った折に地元の友人に会った。
Translation: When I returned home, I met a local friend.

Meaning: with the effect of・because of the effect of・thanks to
Remarks: used to show that an action has been rewarded
Remarks.1: show the anticipated effect of the action has been achieved
Sentence: 彼女は毎日美容院に行ったかいあって髪がきれいだ。
Translation: Her hair is beautiful because of going to the beauty salon every day.

Meaning: without the effect of・because of the no effect of・despite
Remarks: show that an action has been wasted
Remarks.1: show that the anticipated effect of the action has not been achieved
Sentence: 彼女はダイエットをしたかいもなく太ってしまった。
Translation: She has gained weight without having to go on a diet.

Meaning: as long as・all the time while・as far as
Remarks: express a condition or a limit
Sentence: 東京に住んでいる限り家賃を抑えるのは難しいだろう。
Translation: As long as you live in Tokyo, it will be difficult to keep rent down.

Meaning: not yet finished・in the middle of
Remarks: show that an action or a state is incomplete or ongoing
Remarks.1: show an action or circumstance almost or about to unfold
Sentence: 着替えかけているときに電話が鳴った。
Translation: The phone rang when I was in the middle of changing clothes.
Sentence.1: 雨で床が濡れていたので滑って転びかけた。
Translation.1: The floor was wet from the rain and I almost slipped and fell.

Pattern: 〜から言うと / 〜から言って / 〜から言えば
〜からでないと / 〜からでなければ

Remarks: state a general fact that should be done
Remarks.1: an expression used to convey instructions, rules, etc.
Sentence: 試験開始前に注意事項をしっかり読むこと。
Translation: Read the instructions carefully before starting the test.
Sentence.1: 試験の時は鉛筆と消しゴムを忘れないこと。
Translation.1: Don't forget a pencil and eraser for the exam.

Remarks: convey a sense of deep emotion or wonder
Remarks.1: often used with nanto, nante, dorehodo, donnani
Sentence: 本当にどんなに心配したことか。
Translation: I really can't tell you how worried I was.
Sentence.1: どんなに美しいことかこの花は。
Translation.1: How beautiful it is, this flower.

Remarks: convey a sense of deep emotion or wonder
Remarks.1: express uncertainty or probability
Remarks.2: often used with nanto, nante, dorehodo, donnani
Sentence: 宝くじで1億円当たったらどんなに幸せなことだろう。
Translation: How happy I would be if I won 100 million yen in the lottery.
Sentence.1: 明日は雨が降ることだろうか。
Translation.1: I wonder if it will rain tomorrow.

Meaning: from the fact that・due to・because of
Remarks: show the reason or cause of something based on a fact
Sentence: この店は味が良くて安いことからいつも混んでいる。
Translation: This restaurant is always crowded because of its great taste and low prices.
Sentence.1: 彼は音楽が好きなことからピアノを習っている。
Translation.1: He is learning to play the piano because of his love of music.

Pattern: 〜こととなると / 〜ことになると
〜させていただけないでしょうか
〜だけあって / 〜だけのことはあって
〜てしかたがない / 〜てしょうがない
〜てもしかたがない / 〜てもしょうがない
〜となると / 〜となれば / 〜となったら
〜ないことはない / 〜ないこともない
〜ないで済む / なくて済む / ずに済む
〜ないでもない / 〜ないものでもない
〜にしてみれば / 〜にしたら / 〜にすれば
〜のでしょうか /  〜んでしょうか
〜べきだった / 〜べきじゃなかった

Remarks: indicates something as a standard of making or deciding something
Sentence: この小説は実はを基にして書かれたそうです。
Translation: The novel was actually written based on the fact.

Remarks: it is indispensable to previous case
Remarks.1: in order to have the subsequent case
Sentence: 鉄道会社の積極的な取り組みがあってのことなのだ。
Translation: It is because of the proactive efforts of the railroad companies.

Pattern: 〜いかんだ / 〜いかんでは / 〜いかんによっては
〜いかんに関わらず / 〜いかんによらず / 〜いかんを問わず
〜ずにはおかない / 〜ずにはすまない
〜ずにはすまない / 〜ないではすまない
〜を皮切りに / 〜を皮切りとして

Remarks: commanding, ordering
Remarks.1: asking someone to do
Sentence: 塩を取ってください。
Translation: Please pass the salt.

Remarks: asking someone to do
Sentence: パスポートとチケットを見せてくださいませんか。
Translation: Can I see your passport and ticket?

Meaning: can i have you to do
Remarks: asking permission
Remarks.1: requesting something to do
Sentence: なるべくゆっくり話してもらえますか。
Translation: Could you speak as slowly as possible?

Meaning: may i have you to do
Remarks: asking permission
Remarks.1: requesting something to do
Sentence: この本を貸していただけますか。
Translation: Can you lend me this book?

Structure: N to + N to + dochira + desu ka
Remarks: indicates comparison between some things
Sentence: 肉と野菜とどちらが好きですか。
Translation: Do you prefer meat or vegetables?

Remarks: asking someone if it is good
Remarks.1: or is it good to do
Sentence: ご注文は以上でよろしいですか。
Translation: Is that all I have to order?

Remarks: wishing or desiring something
Sentence: 窓側でお願いします。
Translation: Window side, please.

Remarks: honorific form: state an action
Sentence: 社長はもうお帰りになりました。
Translation: The president has already left.

Remarks: honorific form: questions the existence of something
Sentence: 商品もございますか。
Translation: Do you also have a product?

Remarks: honorific form: state the existence of something
Sentence: 私が担当の田中でございます。
Translation: I am Tanaka and I am in charge.

Remarks: giving advice that it is better to do
Sentence: 彼と別れた方がいいです。
Translation: You should leave him.

Remarks: giving advice that it is good or ok to to
Sentence: その本のどちらかを持っていればいいです。
Translation: You can have either of those books.

Remarks: asking advice if it is good
Remarks.1: ok to to do or how to do
Sentence: どう行けばいいですか。
Translation: How can I go about it?

Remarks: asking advice if it is good
Remarks.1: ok to to do or how to do
Sentence: どう使ったらいいですか。
Translation: How should I use it?

Remarks: state the beginning of something that takes time
Sentence: 桜の花が咲き始めましたね。
Translation: Cherry blossoms have begun to bloom.

Remarks: state the end of something
Sentence: 晩ご飯を食べ終わったらみんなでゲームをした。
Translation: After dinner, we all played games.

Remarks: action going on continuously
Remarks.1: emphasize repetition, habit or custom
Sentence: それで我々はマニュアルで進み続けられる。
Translation: So we can keep going manually.

Remarks: tell a command, prohibition
Remarks.1: directions, advice
Sentence: 家族に特定ビジネスから買うように言うことができる。
Translation: You can tell a family member to buy from a specific business.

Remarks: tell a command, prohibition
Remarks.1: directions, advice by someone
Sentence: 医者にお酒を飲まないように言われました。
Translation: I got told by the doctor not to drink alcohol

Remarks: tell someone you are not completely sure of
Sentence: この仕事を全部終えられないだろうと思う。
Translation: I don't think I will be able to finish all this work.

Remarks: give a name, to be called
Remarks.1: introduce the proper name of a common noun
Sentence: 花粉症って病気、アレルギーが原因なんだよね。
Translation: Hay fever is a disease, caused by allergies.

Remarks: give a name, to be called
Remarks.1: introduce the proper name of a common noun
Sentence: 飯の上に乗せたカキフライ丼という料理もある。
Translation: There is also a dish called oyster fried rice bowl which is served on top of rice.

Meaning: it seems that it is not
Remarks: guess something that is not
Sentence: このカレーはあまり辛くなさそうですね。
Translation: This curry doesn't look too spicy.

Remarks: unlikely to do, showing no signs of
Sentence: 今日は晴れそうもない。
Translation: It doesn't look like it will clear up today.

Remarks: unlikely to do, showing no signs of
Sentence: この調子ではいえは買えそうにない。
Translation: At this rate, we won't be able to buy a house.

Remarks: unlikely to do, showing no signs of
Sentence: これらの計画のうちどれも実現しそうにもない。
Translation: None of these plans are likely to materialize.

Remarks: describe a unusual condition
Remarks.1: extent or degree at maximum limit
Sentence: 考えていたほど時間はない。
Translation: We don't have as much time as we thought.

Remarks: express a sequential or simultaneous action
Remarks.1: directional movement and changes with going
Sentence: こうやって悪しきサイクルが果てしなく続いていくのです。
Translation: This is how the bad cycle continues endlessly.

Remarks: express a sequential or simultaneous action
Remarks.1: directional movement and changes with coming
Sentence: 私は誰かが部屋に入ってくるのを聞いた。
Translation: I heard someone come into the room.

Meaning: may i have you to let me do something
Remarks: when you obtain permission
Remarks.1: for someone to do something
Sentence: 少し質問させてもらう。
Translation: Let me ask you a few questions.

Remarks: when you obtain permission
Remarks.1: for someone to do something
Sentence: その許可証を再確認させてくれる？
Translation: Can you let me double check that permit?

Remarks: when you are made
Remarks.1: or forced to something you don’t want to do
Sentence: 今度は濡れた床を掃除までさせられる。
Translation: Now they even make me clean the wet floor.

Remarks: show signs or being or wanting
Remarks.1: used to describe other persons desire
Sentence: 彼女はとても痩せたがっている。
Translation: She wants to lose so much weight.

Remarks: describe a situation that happens right after
Sentence: 家を出たとたん通りで偶然彼女に会った。
Translation: As soon as I left home, I ran into her on the street.

Remarks: describe an action that starts to happen
Remarks.1: or suddenly happens
Sentence: 突然彼女が泣き出したんです。
Translation: Suddenly she started crying.

Remarks: when you try to
Remarks.1: attempt to or about to do something
Sentence: 彼女は起き上がって逃げようとする。
Translation: She gets up and tries to run away.

Remarks: describe an action that you sometimes
Remarks.1: or occasionally do
Sentence: 金沢では吹雪くことがある。
Translation: There are sometimes blizzards in Kanazawa.

Remarks: describe an action that you sometimes
Remarks.1: or occasionally do
Sentence: ライスや豆とともに供することもある。
Translation: Sometimes served with rice or beans.

Remarks: someone made to or instructed to set up something
Remarks.1: and leave it as it may be
Sentence: 乾燥させておく理想的な解決である。
Translation: It is an ideal solution to keep them dry.

Remarks: a receptive action done by someone
Remarks.1: that may be inconvenient
Sentence: 後で食べようと思っていたケーキを妹に食べられてしまった。
Translation: My sister ate the cake I was going to eat later.

Remarks: expresses means or method
Remarks.1: by which something is done
Sentence: ソフトウェアはウェブサイトによって提供した。
Translation: Software was provided by the website.

Remarks: expresses means or method
Remarks.1: by which something is done
Sentence: 大学はアンケートによる満足度調査の結果を発表した。
Translation: The university announced the results of a satisfaction survey conducted by questionnaire.

Remarks: describe a response, direct actions
Remarks.1: or certain attitudes towards
Remarks.2: or against or in contrast to someone or something
Sentence: 彼が考案したこのシステムに対してすぐに抗議の声があがった。
Translation: There were immediate protests against this system he had devised.

Remarks: describe a response, direct actions
Remarks.1: or certain attitudes towards
Remarks.2: or against or in contrast to someone or something
Sentence: 労働力に対する需要は大きい。
Translation: Demand for labor is great.

Remarks: describe a response, direct actions
Remarks.1: or certain attitudes towards
Remarks.2: or against or in contrast to someone or something
Sentence: フィールドに対し必須レベルを設定します。
Translation: Set the required level for the field.

Remarks: express cause or reason to do something
Sentence: 日本へ旅行をするために貯金しています。
Translation: I am saving for a trip to Japan.

Remarks: express cause or reason to do something
Sentence: 職業のための重要な主要業績指標となっています.
Translation: It is an important key performance indicator for the profession.

Remarks: express cause or reason to do something
Sentence: 今度の面接のためにこのスーツを買いました。
Translation: I bought this suit for an upcoming interview.

Remarks: state a piece of or per something
Remarks.1: attaching a case into a situation
Sentence: 店内改装につきしばらく休業いたします。
Translation: We will be closed for a while for store renovation.

Remarks: something happened exactly as said or guessed
Sentence: 話したとおり外は危険だ。
Translation: As I told you, it's dangerous out there.

Remarks: action was done through someone
Remarks.1: or by something or by some means
Sentence: 規範は処罰または報酬を通して強制することができる。
Translation: Norms can be enforced through punishment or reward.

Remarks: giving a kind of, similar
Remarks.1: or typical example
Sentence: 彼はネイティブのように英語を話す。
Translation: He speaks English like a native.

Remarks: giving a kind of, similar
Remarks.1: or typical example

Remarks: used to achieve a purpose of
Sentence: 早く元気になるように栄養たっぷりの料理を作ったよ。
Translation: I cooked a nutritious meal to help you get well soon.

Remarks: indicates an effort
Remarks.1: or something that is habitually kept in mind
Sentence: ビジネスと共に製品が必ず成長するようにする。
Translation: Ensure that the product grows along with the business.

Remarks: indicates a change in the ability
Remarks.1: state or circumstance from what was it before
Sentence: それぞれの仕事の進捗が見えるようになる。
Translation: The progress of each job becomes visible.

Remarks: giving a look alike example

Sentence: モデルみたいになりたくて食べるのをやめました。

Remarks: giving a look alike example
Remarks.1: or appears to be something
Remarks.2: based on some observation, understanding or impression
Sentence: 迷路みたいな小さな路地ばかり。

Remarks: indicates the source of information
Sentence: 新聞報道によれば昨日飛行機事故があった模様である。
Translation: According to newspaper reports, there was a plane crash yesterday.

Remarks: indicates the source of information
Sentence: 天気予報によると明日は雪が降ります。
Translation: According to the weather forecast, it will snow tomorrow.

Remarks: express an information that you have heard
Remarks.1: was acquired indirectly or some hearsay
Sentence: 天気予報によると週末には台風が上陸するということだ。
Translation: According to the weather forecast, a typhoon will make landfall over the weekend.

Remarks: express an information that you have heard
Remarks.1: was acquired indirectly or some hearsay
Sentence: 修理が終わるまでに１週間程度かかるとのことだった。
Translation: He said it would take about a week for the repairs to be completed.

Remarks: express something about something
Sentence: 異なる思考法についてお話しします。
Translation: I will talk about different ways of thinking.

Remarks: express something about something
Sentence: ホルモン補充療法についての教育。

Remarks: express an obligation to do something

Translation: I have to get that file.

Remarks: trying to recall some information
Sentence: あなたは誰に従うんでしたっけ。
Translation: Remember who did you follow?
